Reviews.Title: “The first day was bad, the next four days were good.”
Reviews.Author: Jorgedom
Reviews.Content: On our arrival we were given a very small room. You had to jump over the suitcases. I complained to the reception since I had reserved a "Comfort room" versus a "basic room" . I told them this room had to be a basic room because they could not have anything smaller. After some discussion, they admitted they had made a mistake and they would give us another room. The new room was of a good size, it was in the second floor almost on top of the hotel entrance door. We noticed that the air vents were blowing warm air. My wife called reception and requested to have the air condition system set correctly since the room was too warm. A bell boy came and adjusted it. At 3 am, we could not sleep because of the heat in the room. I opened the large window to the street and the fresh air came in but also the noise of the cars and the conversation of the people in the sidewalk. Since we had just arrived after a 10 hour flight, eventually we went to sleep. Next morning my wife complained to reception and we were told that they were very sorry but the air conditioning was not working on the second floor. Why did you give us that room? Well we did not have any other one available. They gave us another room in the fifth floor (the club level) It was of the same dimensions, but had air conditioning and on the corridor it had an expresso coffee machine, pastries and news papers for free. The next four days were good. They also comp that mornings breakfast (expensive but we were too tired to go outside the hotel). Location is fantastic. On Fridays and Saturdays they have a jazz band playing in the lobby. Security is very good (you need your key to operate the elevator). Internet was not very fast and they changed the password every other day.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and Beautiful getaway”
Reviews.Author: Kristie C
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the Silken Gran and loved every moment! Gorgeous hotel in the heart of downtown. Small but luxurious rooms and fantastic roof-top bar and pool. Excellent restaurant and lounge. Highly recommend this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good location but disappointing amenities and service”
Reviews.Author: oruvan n
Reviews.Content: A group of about 20+ colleagues stayed at the hotel (on business trip). if you really need wifi (like me), stay away from this hotel. They advertise free wifi but you won't get the service in most rooms, not even weak signal. The breakfast was just OK. There was a lot of noise coming from the air conditioner!

Reviews.Title: “Close in, but tucked away. Wonderful balcony.”
Reviews.Author: delaneV
Reviews.Content: We were about a seven minute walk to two different metro stations, close to Passeig de Gracia and many other landmarks. The bedroom area was spacious by European standards and the property was located in a quiet neighborhood just outside the action. Views from the balcony were nice, the sleep area was modern, but the bathroom was a bit dated. Nevertheless, the soaking tub was nice. We found the common areas to be dated, old school high end in appearance. Service at the desk and bar areas were both attentive and informative. It's important to couch this in terms of price...we paid less than $100 USD/night for this hotel using a well known hotel bidding site. At that price point we would classify this property as a tremendous value. I would have been willing to pay to up $160 USD/night for this room. If they upgraded common areas and the suite bathrooms I would go up to $220/night. DO get the best value for your dollar with this property.

Reviews.Title: “Look Nowhere Else”
Reviews.Author: PauloB_Tewkesbury
Reviews.Content: This is a VERY nice hotel, and if you are lucky enough to be there when the jazz groop are in the lobby then stay in! The rooms were spotless, and I have to say the staff member at breakfast who was understanding because we were late and they had just closed (hadn't adjusted our watches from UK time, doh!) was a top bloke! In my opinion this hotel was well located.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: cnic009
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very gorgeous with a quiet rooftop pool out of the way of it all. The staff weren't particularly friendly, otherwise I would have rated the hotel excellent. The rooms were very nice and clean. The entire hotel was modern and of high quality. The balconies had deck chairs so although you were in the centre of Barcelona you felt you were sunbathing elsewhere. The hotel is about twenty minutes from the centre of Barcelona (near las ramblas).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DollyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I saw so many nice comments on here I was not prepared for our experience. Yes, the staff is friendly, the rooms are clean and spacious but the hotel is desperately in need of repairs. The first room we were given was a nice size and quiet but we soon discovered there was a terrible problem with the thermostat. The temperature in the room was 28 degrees celsius ( about 85 degrees fahrenheit)!! the staff was unable to fix it ( which made us think they must have known about this all along) So we had to repack our belongings and were moved to another room. Here the temperature was fine but the safe did not work. We were offered the option to move, yet again. This room was also quite noisey even though we were in the back of the hotel. We could here all the neighbors plumbing (and hanky panky)! Also, the pool was closed and there was no access ot the roof deck. We loved Barcelona-but would not stay here again nor recommend the hotel to anyone. Really a shame because the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Fi1963
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for two nice ladies, felt safe. Clean, modern. Pleasant staff especially Alick hotel porter. 20 min stroll Las Ramblas, 25 min to Sagrada. 8 euro in taxi from Sagarda to Port Vell, excellent value and beautiful place. Big minus to hotel, they want you to upgrade to another room for free coffe lounge. Kettle in room but no coffe supplied, got tea and milk. Luckily I brought some sachets of Millicano as we like our coffe. Shame on you. Also was in room 101, exactly where the view should go. Handy for taxi rank though down below.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: chadgibbs
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by a very pleasant staff at check-in. The English-speaking staff helped us with a map, and gave advice for our trip that evening to watch Barcelona FC play at the Nou Camp. The room was clean, modern, and spacious, though there was not an iron in the room (I believe the hotel provides laundry service). The hotel is in a nice location, only a five minute walk from two different metro stations (Tetuan & Passeig de Gracia), and just a short walk from La Rambla and the Old City. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: RanaM84
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. I liked this hotel most importantly because it is clean. The location is not bad, a short walk to Las Ramblas. The reception were very helpful regarding everything we asked for, even for directions. The staff is very friendly. The other positive thing about this hotel is that it is a short walk to the metro, which was very good for us to go back and forth to the airport. We also went to La Rocha Village outlet mall and also the bus stop was a very short walk. All in all I really like the hotel but I think for next time I will book somewhere in Las Ramblas or somewhere closer than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: funtravelstampa
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (family room) stayed one night last July 2011. Walked everywhere we wanted to go from this location. The location is not crowded or touristy, rather relaxed location in the city. Overall, very clean and nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, needs more attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Ivilina
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on a great location for sightseing but it is long way from Fira Barcelona (I was on a visit related to a tradeshow) and then the traffic needs to be considered. The hotel is ok, but not more. Rooms look good, but the heating is either too much or not working at all (which can be rather annoying at night, when you wake up freezing one night and sweating the other). My bathroom was straight up dirty when I first came into the room, the second day was better. Breakfast was a disapointment. Me and my colleagues (especially the ones with hotel management experience) agreed that most of the staff just needs education and attention.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Yani08
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night. The room was clean and it looked it was recently renovated but very very warm for some reason. Walking distance to plaza Cataluna and Las Ramblas. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Ottimo”
Reviews.Author: Rino180
Reviews.Content: Journey for long week end to visit the city. The hotel is in the very good position and it's close to the underground stop (Girona). The rooms are comfortable, large and clean. Even if you can ear the "sound" of metro, it's not a noise at all. Brakfast good quality and quantity. Park lot available in the hotel and also around it. - It was not possible to set the room temperature.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BovaryB
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location, just blocks from Plaza Catalunya. The rooms were a beautiful contemporary design and were, clean and spacious. The hotel offers free wifi and tea in the rooms. The hotel staff is not the friendliest, but that seems to be standard for Barcelona, it seems. I really enjoyed my stay as the rooms are really aesthetically pleasing and the location central.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: EMIL K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel 4 nights in Autumn 2011. We enjoyed our stay. We had the Atrium Havana a specious room with a separate longue and a very comfortable bathroom. The breakfast is excellent with lots of choise. The staff of the hotel is very friendly and helpful. The location is ideal, a short walk to the elegant Gran Via de Gracia, Plazza Catalunya, the mythical "Rambla", and for shopping. Near the hotal there are good restaurants, like the elegant Claris, on the first floor with a panoramic view of the Gran Via. Typical Mediterranean dishes, good wine, moderate prices. There are also a lot of "tapas" bars in the surroundings. We took a full day tour with Pullmantour located just in front of the hotel. We saw the highlights of Barcelona: in the morning the Cathedral, Gothic Quarter, Sant Jaume Square, Port and Olympic Village, Montjuic, Sant Jordi Palace and visit of the Pueblo Espanyol. The visit included a welcome glass of Catalan Cava and a good 3 course lunch. In the afternoon visit of Parc Güell and a stop in the Sagrada Familia. Entrance fee in Sagrada Familia (Euro 21 pax) is not included. We suggest to go there the next morning, not late because of the ques. It is breathtaking and worthwhile to spend some time to admire the masterpiece of Gaudi. We recommend the Gran Hotel Havana and certainly would stay here again when visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a few problems”
Reviews.Author: Malex2011
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon. I've divided my review into pro's and con's. The Pro's: The location of this hotel was fantastic, right near the Latin and Gothic quarters and only a 20 minute walk to the beach. Lots of good restaurants and shopping nearby, very walkable location. The rooms were very modern and clean. The staff also left us a welcome basket of fruit and wine (I mentioned that we were on our honeymoon). The building itself was nice too. The Con's: Our A/C was broken, so we asked for a new room. In the new room, the A/C was also problematic. Our sleep quality really suffered because of this. The rooftop pool was not as nice as we thought it would be, a bit dirty and extremely cold (in the middle of August). There was also a strong smell of dampness/mould in the lobby. Also, there was no dedicated concierge. The front desk staff made an admirable effort, but I would expect a 4 star hotel to offer more. Overall, we liked this hotel. However, they really need to address the issues that we highlighted. Altogether, not really a four-star experience.

Reviews.Title: “A good break”
Reviews.Author: Fanofspas
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the Gran Havana Hotel and would certainly recommend it. The rooms were very clean and a good size with widescreen tv and a desk. There was a bar adjacent to reception and unusally for a city centre hotel, it had a roof top swimming pool which we did not use as it was the middle of November. The hotel was conveniently located, just a 10 minute walk from La Ramblas and 5 minutes from the nearest Metro station. On the negative side you could feel and hear the metro running underneath and it was also on a main road which was often noisy due to the volume of traffic. Breakfast was not included and 18.75 Euro's was expensive for mostly Continental breakfast (although there was bacon, scrambled eggs and cocktail sausages). If visiting Barcelona again I would certainly consider this hotel but may request a room above the 2nd floor in the hope that sounds of the Metro will will not be as loud.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: MaddyL
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel - front desk staff were very helpful. Room was well-appointed. Housekeeping was excellent. Try the restaurant for dinner - the chef is very good. Sadly its seems very underutilized. Nice lobby bar. Very well situated. We were happy with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely family friendly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: UK-Stu
Reviews.Content: As a family of four (2 boys <5), we were looking for a hotel with connecting rooms and a pool near to but not on La Rambla. We stayed in a suite (Eur230 per night) which had a master bedroom, living area with a double sofa bed and dining area. We had breakfast in the hotel and choice was superb. In addition the staff were amazing. Special mention should be made of Mallick, the doorman, who was great with the kids. You'll find a taxi rank conveniently located outside the hotel. There are many restaurants nearby, including Patagonia Beef and Wine which serves fantastic Argentine food. The rooms were clean, well appointed and just what we needed. Previous comments have focussed on the air con, which seemed fine to us, but as we stayed in October rather than August we require it. We would certainly return and recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A grand 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mac9
Reviews.Content: This is an elegant hotel, well located in the Eixample area of Barcelona. Walking distance (20-30 min) to Sagrada Familia and close to major shopping and great restaurants near Passage de gracia and placa de catalunya. Basic room is large and well appointed. Large patio area and pool on the roof. Live jazz in the lobby on weekends. Good service and an excellent breakfast buffet at 18 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Marie L
Reviews.Content: Definitely don't bother with this hotel! Our room was like an oven, when we called the front desk they advised the airconditioning was broken and offered us a fan which did very little to solve the problem. Service at the hotel left a lot to be desired!

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortably Hot”
Reviews.Author: macca_kent
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after a Med cruise. First the good point - Great location, 10 minutes walk to major tourist area and close to the metro The hotel has a small pool area on the roof - bar area could do with a facelift, having stayed at other hotels in Barcelona with similar facilities, the roof area was poor in comparison. The major drawback for this hotel is the air conditioning - Either it is faulty or it is just not man enough - we had a family room which was two interconnecting rooms with two bathrooms - The rooms were spacious and clean but the heat was very uncomfortable. We had to ask the receptionist to provide two fans, one for each room as it was too hot to sleep - not what you expect from a hotel of this standing. Until they get the aircon sorted, or you go at a cooler time of the year, stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: grumpyguts
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with this hotel. We stayed under a group booking and had not paid massive attention when we selected it, as this had been taken care of by a Travel Agent. Having now read one or two of the reviews on here there is a bit of a common theme...... The check in was laughable, with two dozy staff on duty and a great queue of guests stretching across the foyer waiting. When we finally reached the counter we were treated to a demonstration of how not to welcome new customers to your establishment. The room we were first given was a sweat-box with little or no air conditioning. We went back to the front desk and asked about this. A guy came up to look at the room as they clearly didn't think that I had set it correctly, but he agreed that it should be cold and was not. He then agreed to show us another room. We looked at one that was just as hot and then another that was a little better, which we hd no real choice but to take. The chap then told us that the hotel has four main a/c units, of which three do not work! No wonder then that Allan of our fellow travellers were complaining of the same thing. All the rooms we looked at were tired, with fittings missing and broken and generally as if they were overdue for a refit. The whole air of the hotel is one of feeling that a refurb was due five years ago but then put off due to lack of funds and they are still soldiering on with what they have. I don't know whether this is true, but it certainly seemed that way. Either way the Four Star rating must come from another century. If this hotel were half the price then you would say that it was OK value, but at the rate they charge, this is Not acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Moriantje
Reviews.Content: Our expectations were high as we had stayed in a sister hotel in Bilbao but we were very disappointed. First room we were offered was boiling hot and noisy. We had to make a fuss to be moved to a cooler and quieter room. Staff seemed tense and harried and distant (compared with Bilbao). Breakfast was very ordinary eg no freshly cooked eggs station. Location is good, central and in an area that feels safe at night. The pool was nice and the woman who provided the service at the pool bar was lovely and friendly. Bilbao 5 - Barcelona 1.......

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bill A
Reviews.Content: Read some of the reviews before we went, but having stayed there I can't believe many of them. The staff were all courteous, friendly and efficient. Food was excellent, both breakfast and dinner. There was so much choice for breakfast you could eat enough to last 24 hours. The pool bar on the roof was great. The room was one of the most comfortable we have stayed in and we suffered no noise at all. Only downs were the poor WiFi and the lack of any ironing facilities. Would recommend this hotel and would choose it for any future stays in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - no air conditioning at all.”
Reviews.Author: 716nadams
Reviews.Content: This hotel is recommended by cruise lines as appropriate while in Barcelona. I have no idea why. It is a very old hotel, once very nice, I am sure, but no more. Air conditioning is non-existant and once you get there they walk you to a cheaper hotel. We were told air conditioning was being repaired (on Aug. 23) prior to our cruise, then told same thing again on Sept. 5 (after cruise). It takes two weeks to fix air conditioning problem? However, if you read other earlier reviews, this is a continuing problem. You are better off with another hote.

Reviews.Title: “A hot experience...and not of the nice kind...”
Reviews.Author: Skogpusen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights with a friend. I had a cold when we got there, but it got a lot worse because of the air con that was pumping out warm air instead of cold. It turns out that the air con in the whole hotel was out of order, not just in our room. Close to 30 degrees celsius without an air con is HOT, at least for me.The next day , we got a room new room, that wasn´t on the sunny side and didn´t have the trafficright outside, so you could have the windows open. It helped a little bit. I was sorry that so much time of our short vacation had to go and wait for a new room + pack things up and down. Otherwise the location was good, except maybe it beeing on a road with a lot of traffic. Rooms where a little small, even though we didn´t book the smallest one available. My friend found it hard to find a free sun bed on the roof. That problem should be easy to fix, because there is enough space up there for more. Had a lovely massage in the room booked through the hotel. Comes highly recommended! A tip is to check if the air con is working again, if you are going any time soon, and ask for a room away from the main road.

Reviews.Title: “In-adequate air-conditioning.”
Reviews.Author: Stuart A
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel with everything as expected. Only 1 problem was the air con. First room was 29 deg C located on South side and after 4 hours 7pm to 11pm the room was still 29 deg C. Moved rooms to one at the rear East facing no view small room and 27 degrees for all 3 days we stayed. Avoid during July and August. Excellent for rest of year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel For Us”
Reviews.Author: Sportsman4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights before we went on a cruise. It was in a perfect location, within walking distance of so many things to see. The front desk people were very nice and helpful in suggesting places and things we should so. The hotel is very clean, but the rooms are small. My only complaint was that I wish the air conditioning was a little cooler, but other then that, we enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Ten Minute Walk to Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: helenl8
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a good hotel, close to Las Ramblas but not close enough so the noise would be a problem. We were also price sensitive. We chose this hotel. It was a 10 minute easy walk to Las Ramblas. The room itself was beautiful... arecently renovated. The problem the first night was traffic noise. It is on a main street and the noise was unbearable. We had booked for 3 nights -- so the next day we let front desk staff know and we were changed to an interior facing silent room. The rest of the stay was flawless and wonderful. No breakfast was included and the price for it was expensive. We found a good inexpensive place to eat within a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent old style luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: indep_travel
Reviews.Content: Grand Hotel Havana is a pleasant hotel: interiors have a lot of natural stone and dark wood, decent size pool on the roof, and patio with lounge chairs, not too big but enough to not feel crowded. Attentive staff, nice restaurant, the location is central and convenient to public transport and rail station. Breakfast is abundant. That being said you have to keep in mind that it is a well kept and renovated but still old hotel and it does not have some of the amenities and functionality of the more modern hotels, WiFi could have better coverage, aircon and climate control could be also more powerful, etc. Over all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER AMAZING 2ND VISIT - SHOULD BE 5 STARS”
Reviews.Author: Ebbs88
Reviews.Content: We visited barcelona last year and stayed at this hotel - we loved it so much we returned this year - we just got back from 5 nights at the gran havana. I have to say this is STILL THE BEST HOTEL ive ever stayed it - we had a terrace room with a balcony overlooking the city - staff were very friendly and helpful.Our room was cleaned daily and was spotless everytime - the rooftop pool area is superb - THE MOJITOS ARE AMAZING and the best i've ever tasted. We didn't come across one member of staff who was unhelpful - a young man helped us carry our bags up to our room and showed us where everything was. To the people who are complaining about noise - this is ridiculous its a city for goodness sake and on both visits to the hotel no noise could be heard from the street. i want to thank the staff at the hotel for making another holiday unforgettable - The silken gran havana will always hold a special place with us. one thing i will say . if your looking for a good restaurant not too far from the hotel go to DIVINUS which is 10 mins walk away - we had a beautiful meal there.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced. Over stated”
Reviews.Author: JakeP55
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel for a 4 night trip in April 2011. The room was comfortable enough but the place is very pretentious and clearly classes itself higher than it is. The aircon was broken across the whole hotel and despite the humidity no one seemed very concerned with sorting it out or even dishing fans out. Clean and comfy but we won't be going nack.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but”
Reviews.Author: EMZNetherlands
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the front side off the hotel. You could hear the cars and all the street noise. Even the metro was heard in the rooms. The room itself was nicely decorated, clean and good beds. At the bathroom you could see that it should be renovated to make it a four start hotel. A pity because the hotel has a lot off potential. It was very nice to sit at the rooftop and you have a very nice view from there over the city. Nice place to relax after a day shopping and walking.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with pool”
Reviews.Author: marathonbird
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night before and 3 nights after a cruise in Barcelona. For or 1 night stay our room was a bit small, but for our 3 night stay our room was very spacious and came with a balcony (I'm not sure if our other room had a balcony as we were just there for the one night to sleep and didn't spend much time looking around the room). I also enjoyed the bathroom amenities that you don't always receive, such as toothbrushes and razors, and loved having a pool on the roof and yellow towels for the pool provided in the room. Also, we booked on priceline and were able to get a great deal which made me even happier with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Stevwthw6th
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights in Barcelona prior to a cruise departure. We would both recommend this property - good price, centrally located, walking distance to many of the sights. The staff was helpful, though not as knowledgeable about local dining as we might have expected. The morning brunch was yummy with many veggie-friendly selections. We had one of the upper, outward facing rooms with a terrace which I would highly recommend. There were only two issues keeping it from a rating of 5 - (1) weak and unreliable wi-fi and (2) lack of storage space. We had packed for a two week cruise + three days in Barcelona, so we had two medium sized bags each + carry-ons. There was simply no room for all the stuff - the layout of the room is such that there is a lot of wasted space (like a 4M sq. foyer, WTF?). For a normal trip this would probably not be an issue. I have worked out of hotels in Europe for months on end and (less the wifi issue) this room would be fine for that. Overall a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “A business hotel”
Reviews.Author: richardaw
Reviews.Content: On the positive side we found all staff extremely helpful and friendly with the exception of the porter on duty the morning we arrived-we had to struggle in to the hotel with our 4 suitcases and the doors do not open automatically.! When we finally got our room he merely brought in our luggage and failed to show us around or even point out where the controls for the (hardly functioning air conditioning was which was hiddeen away behind the bedrom door. We reported the malfunctioning aircon but to no avail When we arrived the weather was great, our room was not ready but nobody mentioned that there was a roof garden we could have used instead we had to wait airport style in the Reception area We booked the hotel as part of a post Celebrity Cruise package and of the couple of hotels they offered this was the nearer of the 2 to the centre but still quite a way away. Most of the time we were in Barcelona this time the weather was terrible so we ate dinner in the hotel. The food was fine and the service excellent but the fixed price menu is only changed once a week The room was extremely comfortable and well laid out. The only poor element was the TV reception which as though the aerial wasn't connected. We requested a room in a quiet part of the hotel and we got one. Really glad we made the request as this is very much a business hotel with lots of conferences and the inevitable noise that accompanies them I also found it impossible to access the free wi-fi and paid to use the hotel's computer. What a crazy location-2 feet from Reception and bang outside the hotel office-extremely difficult to concentrate A pleasant hotel especially if we had been there on business but felt it was overpriced for waht it offers. We would not stay there again

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay but won't be back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: irishgalathome
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine, more "good business class" than 4*... We stayed for a week. Didn't eat there. The rooms are fine, but not worth the price we paid, and I've stayed in a lot of (both very fancy, and very ordinary) hotels. I would go as far to say that I was disappointed (we had a Solarium room, and it was nowhere NEAR the size it appears on the webpage). The staff, with the exception of one doorman who was friendly, helpful and cheerful, were illmannered, unfriendly, and only helpful insofar as their job went, never going above or beyond. We needed a late checkout and were treated very rudely about it, and lied to, despite our willingness to pay for the privilege. Either way... there are a few places to eat and drink around about the area, but be prepared to walk. There's a GREAT bar at the corner, up the road from the hotel that does good sangria and tapas, and v friendly owners/staff... but it's closed on Sundays and public holidays, so be aware (if you come out of the hotel, turn right, walk one block up, diagonally opposite you there's a bar on the corner... recommended... mainly peopled by locals too). Despite being on the 6th floor, we could still hear the rumble of the metro underneath, and it was a good thing that pretty much all of the other rooms on that floor were empty, because the 2 nights that we had neighbours, the (normal) noises from their rooms came through the walls no problem. The rooms were more-or-less cleaned, however behind the doors were never vacuumed, from what I can see, and there were open safety pins on the floor that weren't picked up. Despite ringing ahead to pre-advise our check-in, and to organise a surprise fruit basket and cava for my other half (we were celebrating our anniversary), the room wasn't available (despite the floor being more than 2/4 empty), the "basket" didn't arrive until 2 hours later, and all it consisted of in the end was a plate with some under-ripe kiwis, apples and over-ripe strawberries... a total rip-off. I have been to Barcelona several times now and will go back again, however it may be a while, and when I do, I won't be staying here again... you can definitely do better.

Reviews.Title: “Like the Hotel did not like the Location or the Havana Club”
Reviews.Author: Realtorviajero
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is nice and clean, the rooms are great, the staff very friendly. We have stayed in other Hotel with a great Club level, but the Club level at the Havana Silken was a bog disappointment. The coffee was good but by the evening there were no clean cups to serve yourself. The only food was small crousaints and very sweet treats that constantly run out and took a while to refile. Definitively not worthed! The location is good but not the best. You have to walk a minimum of 3 blocks for transportation or to get something to eat. It is close to the action but not where the action is. If you have the time to walk or like to talk taxis everywhere stay at this Hotel, otherwise find one in a better location. The rooms and the staff are very good.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here if i visit again”
Reviews.Author: MrsB
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Barca. Its a lovely clean hotel with high standards. We booked the standard room, not expecting a great deal but just somewhere to sleep after a busy day. We were pleasantly suprised. The room was lovely, with a lovely marbled bathroom and towells for the pool also, CD player, TV, coffee making facilities. Unfortunately our air con wasn’t working on the first night so we had a word with reception the following morning who said somebody would take a look straight away and we headed off out for the day. That evening it still wasn’t fixed so we complained again and the reception guy came up, very friendly and got us moved to another room. We asked for a quiet room initially and insisted we did this time. We got given one at the back and it was clearly an upgraded room, even better than the first, separate lounge area, bigger bath, HUGE bed! slippers, dressing gown etc. Both rooms have minibar. The roof top pool is great, only small but was quiet at all times, given there was only about 12 sun loungers there were always spare ones and open till 9pm (Summer) so after a long day sight seeing we sat up on the roof around 8pm in the sunshine which was perfect. Only thing missing is a bar up there, there is a small outlet but this appeared to be only open some of the time. the vending machine wasnt working either but we took our own drinks up with us. The reception staff were extremely helpful and friendly, helping us with tickets for the Bus Turistic (open top bus) which gets you 2 euros off if you purchase at reception and a map etc. I cannot mark the restaurant as i didnt use it so although I have marked “1″ this is because there is no option for N/A. Great location for everything. Come out of the hotel, turn right and walk straight down (or down the various interesting side streets) and within 10 mins you’re at passage de gracia, calalunya square and then onto la rambla. Near enough to get to on foot but far enough away not to be disturbed by street noise. We did ask for a quiet room and were on the 3rd floor, it was quiet all night and perfect. I gather the metro maybe goes underneath the hotel as there is a noise every 5 mins or so but I only noticed this whilst sat in reception. Taxi to and from the airport was between 25 and 30 euros and the taxi rank was right outside the hotel. Only thing I would have liked is perhaps more of a selection of room service including a drinks menu or another casual bar, as there is one hotel bar but on the evening we actually did stay in there was a cocktail evening on which you had to reserve a table. We chose that night to sit up by the pool instead and had a bottle of cava from the minibar! Free safe in the room which was very good. If you are looking to stay in Barca I would recommend this hotel to you and would stay here if I ever visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandymac1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean. It is a few blocks away from Las Ramblas but within walking distance. Bring your own hairdryer that can convert to their power or use a plug converter as their hairdryer in the bathroom is not good. The air conditioner really did not get cold and you must keep one of your room keys in the light slot for the air to work and you manually just turn out the lights at night. Ifyou arrive before check in time they will keep your luggage in a locked room for you while you go out to explore. Try to get a room that faces the back courtyard then you can open the window without alot of noise. We also did the breakfast included and it was good. Do not exchange money there as they use a higher exchange rate then the currency exchange places. They also made our private transportation pick up from the airport and also to the cruise terminal and the company they used was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: erinm51
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, a great mix of old world charm and modern comforts. The location was a bit of a walk away from all the action and the metro but was not a problem for us at all. The city is a very clean and wonderfull city. We also enjoyed the coffee machine and pastries on our floor and the roof top area.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eirik_11
Reviews.Content: We got married in Barcelona, and stayed at this hotel for five days. We also had our wedding dinner at the hotel. The staff were extremely friendly, they went out of their way to make this a perfect evening. The food was excelent, both for the wedding dinner, breakfast and for lunch another day. Our guests (10 together) were satisfied with the hotel as well. For sightseeing, the location was central, with many attractions within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “wow hotel, exellent location right in the heart of barcellona”
Reviews.Author: pleasure721
Reviews.Content: elegant and modern hotel in the centre of barcellona, very clean and very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and spacious room”
Reviews.Author: Encrenca
Reviews.Content: I was not at the hotel a lot, however was pleasantly surprised with the size of the room, decoration and it's service. Nice staff at reception. Rooms are large and clean. Bed and pillows are very confortable. Centrally located with easy access to Pga. de Catalunya with airport buses, tourist buses, shopping, etc.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel met all our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Cotehele
Reviews.Content: It has become an annual custom for our group of four seasoned travellers to get away from the winter blues in the U.K and visit one of our European Capital cities for a short break. This year it was decided that Barcelona should be the venue. Prior to making all the travel arrangements, I carried out my normal practice of using Trip Advisor to check out our intended hotel. On this occasion it was The Silken Gran Havana Hotel, Grand Via Corts Catalanes, 647 . The write- ups seemed okay and the booking was made.The stay occured between 3th and 5th January 2011. Having arrived at Barcelona airport it was decided to use the Aerobus that moves between the airport and the centre of the city. The cost for four people was some 22 Euros, which seemed a good deal. It also gives you the chance to begin to experience the buzz of the city. As it turned out, a taxi from the hotel to the airport was 26 Euros. The bus took us to the Place de Catalunya which is literally the city centre.From the Place de Catalunya, along Gran Via Corts to the hotel was a walk of about 20 minutes with cases. Not a problem. From the time of getting off the bus, you become aware of the enormous amount of people moving about . There was a terrific atmosphere of people shopping, strolling and enjoying the Christmas atmosphere that still existed,helped by the beautiful christmas decorations everywhere. The entrance to the hotel is both elegant and welcoming. The foyer is large and open, and ones attention is immediately drawn to the way in which the centre of the foyer is open to the roof top and each floor can be seen leading off from the glass covered space which made up what was almost a funnel effect. Most effective and different. The foyer was beautifully decorated with a huge christmas tree, and later when it got dark, it was discovered that the whole of the front of the hotel was illumnated by beautiful lights.Magical. The staff at the reception desk were very attentive and gave the impression that nothing was too much trouble. The booking in process was painless and assistance was given if needed with carrying luggage to the room.We stayed on the sixth floor which is the top floor before the roof top swimming pool. The rooms were large, well appointed and scrupulously clean.The bed was extremely comfortable with ample pillows. There was tea making facilities, a mini bar and safe. The large flat screen TV. had several english speaking channels and a separate radio/cd player.Well up to a four star standard. The bathroom was pure luxury. Each bed room had a sizeable individual balcony, access to which was through french windows, which in turn gave additional light into the room. On the balcony was a table, two chairs and sun loungers (perfect for a summer visit to enjoy the gin and tonic on!) . The breakfast room was large and had a variety of seating arrangements. The selection and variety of food avaliable for breakfast was immense.The staff were very attentive, and moved quickly and efficiently to ensure there were always freshly laid tables available. As we were only going to be in the city for two whole days, it was decided to use the hop on /off tourist bus service, called Barcelona Bus Touristic. You cannot miss the buses, which are either coloured blue or red with open tops(which can be covered over in inclement weather - we didn't have any). The reception staff were able to provide us with introductory packs for the bus, which meant that when we bought our tickets, a discount was given on the full price.You can buy tickets at the places where the buses stop, which are indicated by a distinct type of bus stop.The Bus Turistic is excellent value for money and has two distinct routes. One route takes in the city centre area, and the other the suburbs which includes the mountain area overlooking the city (must be visited, particularly if you have children).It is the usual hop off/on service and the waiting time between each bus is never more than 10-15 minutes. As there is so much to see in and around the city, it is worth buying a two day ticket . With the discount given, a one day ticket is 20 Euros whereas a two day ticket is 27 Euros. Excellent value As the buses cannot go down Las Ramblas and the market areas off both sides, it is worth spending some time on foot in this area before using the tourist bus . When it came to finding a place for dinner, the list was endless.We had already been recommended to visit 4CATS Restaurant which is just off Las Ramblas, which was within a fifteen minute walk of the hotel. A table was booked during the day which was fortunate, because the place was crowded out. The food, service and atmospshere made for an excellent evening. For the second evening we called upon the hotel to recommend an eating place. A restaurant called Ca La Nuri some ten minuites walking time from the hotel was recommended and a booking made . The evening ws a tremendous success with good food and excellent service. At lunch on the last day, before getting back to the airport we stumbled upon yet another excellent eating place, again only minutes from the hotel called Tasca & Beer. Excellent service, food and good value. It was soon time to call to an end our short break and return to the cold of the U.K. A marvellous short stay which was made even better by the experience of The Gran Hotel Havana and its staff , coupled with so many things to see and do. A return visit is already being planned to carry on where we left off.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with this property”
Reviews.Author: Tom096
Reviews.Content: Easy walking distance to central tourist sites, helpful front desk, comfortable room, modern and top quality furnishings. All in all a very good choice for us as first time visitors to BCN.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: stormstorr
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel located about 10 minutes walk from the city centre. Rooms were clean well furnished and comfortable. Staff friendly and very helpful. Quite a lot of room noise as room faced onto main road that was very busy. Double glazing didnt make much difference. Suggest trying to get room overlooking the side street. Theres also vibration from the metro that feels like it runs underneath the hotel. Only 3 english speaking TV channels Free WiFi appauling - premium service (15 euros for 3 days) not much better. Had to make 2 calls to tech supprt - and was charged for the calls! Breakfast very well presented and sufficiant - but not worth 17 euros a head. A nice stay though

Reviews.Title: “Fine but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: NYC_Iowa
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights in Barcelona so wanted somewhere convenient to see the city and comfortable to adjust to the time difference. Our travel agent recommend this and it was fine, but we didn't love the location. Nothing bad, just nothing special/good in the couple blocks surrounding - a quick walk got you that but really, nothing right outside. The room was small but modern, big comfy bed took up most of the space. Little balcony (standing size only) and the rooftop area was VERY small - don't plan on really relaxing up there unless you're ok being literally side by side with strangers. It was fine for the price, time we spent there and sleep quality - but if you are in Barcelona for a honeymoon or plan to spend time in your room/in the immediate hotel area...look elsewhere. If you're just looking for something basic, like we were...this is your spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice room, odd area”
Reviews.Author: dss1953
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! With the help of priceline we got a great rate for 5 nights. It's super close to Passeig de Gracia so getting to/from the airport was not an issue. There's not a whole lot to do around the immediate area of the hotel, but as stated above, Passeig de Gracia is nearby with all that it has to offer: shopping, eating, drinking, sightseeing (Casa Batllo & La Pedrera), the Ramblas, Placa Catalunya, the Metro station and on and on and on! Barcelona is such a great walking city and this hotel is well situated for that. But don't expect to find a place to grab a bottle of water after 7pm or a late night nosh at midnight. There's just nothing around. (At least that we could find.) Our room was really great. Super high ceilings, wood floors, dark wood accent panel and gray walls which made a very big room seem cozy and warm. We heard a little street noise, but nothing to keep us awake (aside from the lone El Classico reveller with his vuvuzela). :-) All in all a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel let down by poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TarnHowsEngland
Reviews.Content: An average hotel but not value for money. Friendly staff and clean comfortable rooms that are large with good facilities. The hotel is within walking distance of all the major attractions but far enough away for a quiet night's sleep. The staff are all professional and helpful but the breakfast was below average for the price. Roof terrace is a good addition with nice views of the city. I would recommend this hotel if you are not bothered about the quality of the breakfast offered. Be very careful of pickpockets around the Metro stations as they work in gangs to distract tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: oxymoron2010
Reviews.Content: So, I was again in barcelona for a short weekend trip. On recommendation of a friend we decided to stay here. We had an extremely quiet, comfortable and adequately sized room. The room was clean and comfortable. The morning breakfast was good. The location close to Ramblas is perfect for touristic purposes. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisail
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before a cruise and it was great. Short walk to the Las Ramblas area and nearby restaurants, etc. The staff was very friendly, giving directions to restaurants, calling cabs, etc. The rooms were very nice. Would stay at this hotel again if we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs - very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Frequentflyer556
Reviews.Content: Noisy - subway noise even on 4th floor Poor quality room cleaning Poor sound insulation between rooms - felt like cheap youth hostel Horrible smell of carpet cleaner in hall walkways Cheap &nasty plastic glasses in bathroom fascia around tv fell off every night! Tired linen/towels Noisy plumbing Very over priced - much better value to be had in the same area

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: storeycreekadmin
Reviews.Content: We chose the Silken Gran Havana because of the proximity to La Ramblas and other sites close by. It is a perfect location to walk around the city and hop on a bus. The hotel was wonderful, clean and beautiful. The rooms were modern and clean with top quality furnishings. We loved the roof-top pool, patio and bar!!! What a romantic place to have spent our 15th wedding anniversary! We hope to travel from Canada again and visit this first-class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Smooth as silk”
Reviews.Author: Marcus_O_Really
Reviews.Content: Pricelined this one and was not disappointed. We spent three nights here and had a huge room on the 4th floor. Two comfy double beds next to each other. Decent sized flat screen. Big bathroom. Small balcony for you to go outside to smoke or gawk at the pedestrians. Place was clean. Front desk staff very helpful. Location puts it a bit out from the usual tourist area. Metro a five minute walk in couple of different directions. Air worked fine. We didn't use any of the onsite facilities except for the bar. Plenty of restaurants and cafe's nearby. Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen1
Reviews.Content: Just 10 minutes walk from La Ramblas. Designer feel rooms – very spacious but a bit dark. Breakfast limited if you are Coeliac – no bread. Friendly staff would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid rooms on the lower floors at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: phyllbell
Reviews.Content: This hotel proved to be clean and very comfortable and in an excellent location, and the breakfasts were very good and the staff excellent - BUT we had a room facing the street on the first floor, and the noise and vibration of the Metro passing underneath the hotel was enough to keep us awake. I would certainly recommend this hotel but would strongly advise guests to refuse any rooms on the first floor - I spent the whole week sleeping with ear plugs in!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean, Basic”
Reviews.Author: AuditChic
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Room colors are very soothing. Room was clean, Air conditioning worked well. Comfortable room, but a bit small for a basic room. Our stay was pleasant. The hotel treated us to a bottle of champagne for our honeymoon. Overall, would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: Euro_june
Reviews.Content: Not the worst hotel - not the best. Rooms could be better maintained but were clean and comfortable Well within walking distance to heart of city - but not a central location

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Ishay27
Reviews.Content: Beyond the very nice external classic appearance, rooms are very modern and comfortable. Though slightly on the smaller side, I thought the room was very nice (though my room had a window to the inner hall, which wasn't idea, since I didn't have any view, but anyone walking down the corridor had a view of me). The bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was very good. Complimentary internet is great to have (when will all hotels have that?!). Location is quite good - 4 blocks from Plaza Catalunya, and there's even a bus 100 meters outside the hotel. Metro stations are also very close. I would definitely stay there again on my next visit to Barcelona. The rooftop pool is nice, but don't expect a swimming pool; just a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not as close to the sites as they make out”
Reviews.Author: aerin-sol
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gran Havana for 2 nights prior to a cruise. The short answer is that is a decent room with a comfy bed that was cleaner looking and feeling than my balcony cabin on the cruise ship. Better than I expected from a European hotel given all the horror stories I was told. The only reason I wouldn't stay there again was because it's not as close to Passeig de Gracia (the street everything is on) as some reviews lead you to believe. Now for the details if you're interested.... Shocker, my plane landed an hour early and customs only took as long as stamping my passport. Not a long wait for my bag either and traffic from the airport to the hotel at 8:00 in the morning is minimal so I arrived at my hotel by 8:30 a.m. Check in isn't until 3:00. The people at the counter stored my suitcase, but told me 1:00 was the earliest I could expect a room, go explore the city. Being out of it because of the whirl, it took me an hour to realize that I was hot, swollen, icky, hungry and hadn't used a bathroom in about 4 hours. It would have been nice if, when storing my bags, they had offered me the use of a courtesy suite or bathroom so I could change my clothes, put some sunscreen on and wash up a little even if all I did was splash my face. After walking around Barcelona for 3 hours and grabbing some breakfast, I needed some air conditioning so I headed back to rest in their lobby. Whether they wanted me out of the lobby because I looked like heck at this point or they really did have a room ready early, they hailed me around 11:30 and put me in my room. At first the room was stuffy, but a quick read of the book by my bed told me how the control worked and I adjusted the temp. The bathroom was adequate and not hard to use except that it took me 2 days to figure out how to open and close the drain in the tub w/o pulling it up by hand. I like that you can turn on the shower from a knob on the side of the tub so you aren't instantly hit in the face with cold water. All showers should be this way. Lots of toiletries to steal. I was on the first floor and never heard the metro, but I did hear businesses putting trash in the big bins outside my window most of the night and people talkings in the street. Explored the roof top pool/bar where they serve light meals most of the day. Also home of a vending machine that sells bottled water for 2 Euro (the cheapest I saw on my trip). Pool isn't as tiny as a jacuzzi, but 6 people would leave it standing room only. I read somewhere that it was "fancy" up there and made swimming awkward, but it was very casual. The sandwich I had was good and reasonably priced. Good view of the city and both tables with umbrellas and lounge chairs to sit on. Every staff member I met spoke English, and I think the "uninterested" comment is because there is sometimes a translation lag. They joked with me and gave me directions when needed. That night I ate in the Grand Place, the restaurant downstairs. I opens at 8 p.m., I waited until 8:30, and was alone in there until 9:10. I knew they ate late, but I was starving and was messed up on my times to begin with. Food was great, but they charge for bread and don't tell you. Not much, couple Euros, but beware. Also the Flan Havana isn't like normal Flan, I could had drank it with a straw. The next day I did breakfast there because it was included with my room. As it was included, it was ok, but if it's not part of your room's price don't bother. A very small buffet filled with unlabled foods that weren't always identifiable. I'm not an egg eater, I prefer a pastry and tea or milk, but if you like eggs you won't find them here. Fruit choices change daily. I had chocolate croissants and fruit both mornings. I should note they don't seem to know what to do with solo diners, always flustered to find me a table for one. Must not be thing in Spain. What I also noticed was that on Saturday when I got to breakfast at 9:00, it was kind of picked over, but the shops don't open until a not very prompt 10:00 (more like 10:10) even though everyone will tell you they open at 9:30-10:00. When I got up earlier on Sunday for my cruise transfer there was a bigger selection at breakfast. Take your pick: more food with time to kill before you can do anything or less food and right out to shop. On my first full day there, Saturday, I went shopping and discovered that it was a 3 block walk to reach Passeig de Gracia (didn't notice the day before) and then you had to walk the length of that street in either direction to see it all. Going back to the hotel I noticed the crowds thinned out and the neighborhood was less...nice. Still not bad looking, but it's not as reassuring as what I left behind on P de G. That really struck me after dark when it was time to eat. There are no quick, 5 step places to eat near the Havana beyond the hotel restaurant and the rooftop bar. A few fancy places a block or 2 away, but as I was a woman alone, I didn't like walking 2 blocks in the dark. Had I stayed at a place on P de G, I could have found a restaurant everywhere I looked and never walked a block. The up side is that I didn't encounter beggars who may or may not have been scam artists trying to see where my wallet was every time I left the hotel and when walking on P de G, I saw they outside most hotels. People say it's quieter being off the main strip, but there is still noise. When all is said and done, if I had it to do over, I would have stayed at a hotel on Passeig de Gracia so I spent less time walking and more time seeing things.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - best in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Ebbs88
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Silken Gran hotel Havana, What a fantastic hotel, We payed £646 for 7 nights in a basic room, it was a lovely cool room with a nice view overlooking the street, I was a little skeptical about staying there as i heard the metro underneath was proving an issue for some guests but this seriously isn't bad as some people have made out, we were staying on the 3rd floor and you can barely here it. The hotel itself is very impressive along with its rooftop pool which was bigger than first thought, there are also some impressive views which can be seen, every single member of staff we came across spoke English and couldn't help us more even if they tried, they made us feel very welcome , the gentleman on reception even lifted our bags up to the room even though we said it was OK,the location of the hotel is just right, its bang in the center, 10 minutes from Las Ramblas and 10 minutes on the metro to the beach/port. If you are staying at the hotel on a friday/saturday you must attend the Live Jazz as it really adds to the atmosphere. We didn't eat at the hotel but had a few cocktails, Yes they were expensive but they really put there effort into them. Overall this hotel is absolutely fantastic, the best i have stayed in, i would recommend this hotel to anyone. We loved it so much we are booking again for next summer. Tip: If you want to head down to the beach, head to the "girona" metro station on the next street from the hotel, it costs 1.40 for 1 single on any route on the line, get off at barcelonetta and your there.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: leedap
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located to the gothic area and La Rambla with easy access to restaurants. The staff was helpful with directions and maps. They were attentive to our concern about a musty odor at our room entrance. The problem was handled quickly. The room was not as cool as we are used to but liveable. The room was modern with internet ports and flat screen wall TV. Our room included breakfast which was beautiful in variety and presentation. After a hot day walking the streets, the rooftop pool was quite refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “A greate stay in wonderful Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Hennes2
Reviews.Content: We booked a basic room at Silken Gran Hotel Havana in the summer holidays (only 700Euros without breakfast) for 7 nights. It was a great hotel with short distanse from placa Cataluna and shopping. The roofterrace was great and had a nice little swimmingpool. The only think that was a bit anoying, was that the internett didn't work. The next day I asked the resepction why, and then he asked me: Don't you have the code? Nobody had given med the code, and everyday we had to get the code from the reseption. It's not a big thing, but they could told me that.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: CRISTINAThessaloniki
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spend our holidays in Barcelona this summer. We spent really much time searching for a hotel to book since we were going to spend 8 whole days in the city and we didn't want to get disappointed. We checked almost all hotels in Barcelona through trip advisor and chose Silken Havana at the end. I must admit that we made the right choice. The hotel was very well located. Only 5 minutes walk from "Girona" metro station and 10 minutes walk from the "Passeig De Gracia" metro station & street which is the most popular shopping/ elegant street of the city (with Gaudi masterpieces). La Rambla was only 15 minutes walk as well as Plaza Catalunya. During our stay and our tour around the city we spotted the other hotels we were looking before booking, and Havana was the best by far (especially due to its location). The neighbourhood of the hotel wasn't dangerous at all during the night. As far as the room is concerned, we booked the "Solarium" room on the 6th floor (room Nr.605). Really clean & modern. It was also and excellent choice because in that height you avoid the traffic noise. Especially room 605 facing Carrer Del Bruc was pretty quiet. We also requested a king size bed just to be sure beforehand that we will have a good sleep. It was perfect! Something really nice was also the jazz nights they organise once in a month. If you are lucky you might attend one. Furthermore, once in a week they have great piano nights. As for the terrace, it was really beautiful (with nice view at Tibidabo hill) although we hadn't time to spend there (there are so many other MUSTDO things in Barcelona than sitting in the hotel terrace). I went upstairs just to take some pictures. The only thing I didn't like was that the terrace closes at 9 - 10 o clock! It would be nice to have a late drink, up there after your Barcelona evening walks. Regarding breakfast, I must admit that it was not the best I've ever had. Our reservation was made without including the breakfast by purpose and that was another good decision. It was very expensive. They were asking 20 euros per person, per day, so that meant 40 euros per day per couple for having just breakfast! We had everyday a nice "Starbucks" (2 in the area) breakfast for 15 euros both! I went only one morning alone to try the breakfast by curiosity and that's why I mentioned that it was not the greatest I have ever had. Regarding the reception customer service, well...it was not what you expect from a 4 star hotel but I didn't really bother. They just didn't spoke English very well and they didn’t provided us with any usefull suggestions for restaurants etc. I particularly asked them if a restaurant I have chosen (from a tourist guide list) was nice and they just respond: "Ιf you have planned to have dinner there, then do so". All in all, Havana Hotel was a good hotel experience and it will be in my top list of hotels if I ever visit Barcelona again. CRISTINA – GREECE

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: YorkVikingWalk
Reviews.Content: We have been to Barcelona five times now and this is by far the best hotel we have stayed in. It is comparable in style to the Majestic just round the corner, but it is a much better hotel and a much lower price. There are several positives with this hotel. The location is ideal. It is just off the main road, close to the many Gaudi buildings and in the district where all the nice restaurants are. It is also a short distance to the Ramblas. The room we stayed in was excellent. It overlooked the lobby area and consisted on a smaller sitting room attached to the main bedroom. It was comfortable and the bathroom was excellent. Everything was spotlessly clean. It was one of the better rooms we have stayed in anywhere. Other smaller things. Breakfast is very good in a large comfortable room.. The staff are friendly though very occasionally a little disinterested (this is the only negative I can think of and it only happened once). The roof pool is also great, though we didn't really get the weather. There was no sign of anyone serving drinks there but that was possibly as the weather wasn't great. Overall I think this is a great hotel which I will re-book next time I am in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, good location, pleasant service”
Reviews.Author: rumfucius
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silken Gran Havana over Christmas 2009. It's a lovely old looking building from the outside and nicely refurbished on the inside. The staff were very friendly, the checkin process was smooth and the room was a good size. The beds were extremely comfortable - we slept very well there although our room was facing the main street and so could be a bit noisy at times. The location of the hotel is very good - walking distance from Plaza Catalunya, Passeig de Gracia and a short walk away from 3 train stations, so very well connected. There's a rooftop pool which would probably be great in summer though in December we just went up there for the view! We didn't eat at the hotel, though the bar at the lobby has some great live music playing in the evenings. All in all, a very nice hotel and we'd definitely think about staying here the next time we're in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location To See Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: scvrose
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Barcelona, and we found this gem of a hotel. Close to the metro, shopping, excellent restaurants, Plaza Catalunya, La Ramblas, train station and Gaudi houses. We walked the whole town from this location. The beach is within an easy walking distance (< 1 mile). The taxi stand is right outside the hotel which we also used extensively. The rooms were well appointed, bed very comfortable, and we loved the large balcony. We often relaxed on the balcony with a good serrano ham, machego cheese, and a bottle of Spanish wines. Life was good. The hotel staff spoke very good English, were extremely helpful, and the breakfast buffet was excellent! Not a large hotel, it is pretty quiet. On Friday and Saturday nights they have entertainment around a well equipped bar/lounge. The food at the restaurant for dinner was very good and a good selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Schmoo1973
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at this hotel, my first was on a hen weekend, this time it was with my Husband and both times the stay has been wonderful. The rooms are lovely, the first time I was in a single occupancy room which was very nicely decorated and spacious. My latest stay was in the upgraded room on the first floor which is an circular room with a window which opened onto which I can only describe as an inner courtyard. The decor was lovely and the bathroom was clean and nicely decorated. The only very minor downside was that the room was located next to the lift so you could hear the occasion hum of the lift working, but it was very easy to get used to. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a great location for Las Ramblas as it's only a 5 / 7 minute walk to the main Las Ramblas street and to all the lovely cobbled streets and 10 / 15 minute walk to the port . I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: SudhanshuModi
Reviews.Content: 1. The hotel is located at the centre of the city with beach at a distance of around 1 mile or taxi costs of around 6-7 Euros. 2. The hotel provides you with a good service and a lot of facilities. There is a wonderful bar in the lobby. 3. Crew speaks english which really helps in communicating. The hotel staff is very helpful and accomodating with a little delay in checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, professional and helpful”
Reviews.Author: esined_smit
Reviews.Content: I write this review whilst in this hotel. I am stuck in Barcelona due to the Europe air space shutdown. I have spent 6 nights in total in this hotel and I have to say that the staff are sooooooooo very friendly and hospitable. From reception staff, laundry, door man, resturant, bar they were wall so professional. THe laundry lady must have seen I was desparate and needed some clothes cleaned including pyjams and she brought them back to with within hours. The room service food was excellent. The prices at the bar was suprising very reasonable. If I come back to BArcelona which I will I will stay at this hotel again. The location is fab - 10 min walk to Playa Catalyna. The only negative I would say about this hotel is it is a bit dated. My first room I had no view just a white brick wall but was quiet, 2nd room a balcony - which is noisy with traffic. Also another good reason to stay here is your hotel card you need for the lift, so no one not staying at the hotel can get to the rooms. Thank you staff at Gran Havana so much.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: einavi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very elegant and I recommend staying there. Its location is central and close to the main attractions. I was able to walk almost everywhere and felt secure in the surrounding neighborhood. The reception staff was polite, helpful and spoke good English. I would not recommend having the overpriced breakfast at the hotel, as there are many nearby cafes, bars and restaurants. My room was clean and very comfortable. I stayed in a basic room which was located close to the door of the maids cleaning tools. Yet, personally I was not distracted by any noise. My room did not have any view; on the other hand, it did not have any street noise either. Bed was large and very comfortable. Bathroom was well equipped with all toiletries needed, which was very convenient. On Fridays and Saturdays, between 19:30 and 21:30 h concerts of swing music are being held. Occasionally they have jazz concerts which add to the pleasant atmosphere in the hotel. Free wi-fi is offered throughout the building, but the internet point at the reception can be used for 2 euros per day. Overall I enjoyed my stay and find the hotel definitely to worth its 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Comfortable Hotel which is well located”
Reviews.Author: sunny-singh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights after getting a buy 2 nights get 1 free deal. The hotel was located just off Catalunya De Plaza and a 5-7 minute walk to Ramblas which was perfect for us as we did not want to stay right on that strip. Our room was nice and modern and bed comfortable. Bathroom was fairly big and we had no issues. Only minor complaint i would have is that from our room we could hear the trains pass under us every so often but to be honest im a deep sleeper so once i was asleep it was fine. During the day we were out most of the day as well. If returning to Barcelona i would be more then happy to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “What a place!!”
Reviews.Author: Virgoletta1975
Reviews.Content: We arrived here at noon on a rainy Easter last week, after I had finished a tour that morning, and although it was early to check-in, the kind consierge gave us a nice and spacious room on the second floor. The hotel is elegant, beautiful huge rooms with a fantastic king size bed and lcd tv. We did not get any breakfast as we like to wander around and look for different places to eat every day, but I am sure that the breakfast at the hotel would be nice indeed. I got a deal using a very well known web-site for hotel search, so if you wish to stay here, first check in the web for special rates!

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: Neilg81
Reviews.Content: Very helpfuly staff, nice tidy clean very well presented, breakfast was lovely!! location was very central walking distance to every where, car park was very handy under the hotel lift straight up to your room!! would love to stay again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Room Prices in an Expensive City”
Reviews.Author: AyrshireBacon
Reviews.Content: We drove from Girona to Barcelona in a hire car at night and despite the confusing road signs, found ourselves outside the hotel which would seem be to up a bus / taxi lane to the unfamiliar as we were... it was actually quite easy to locate. The underground car park is up a one way street against the flow of traffic from the main road so you'll need to drive around the block, the car park itself is very poorly signed and don't expect to arrive in a sports car as the gradient down to the sub-terranian area is very steep indeed - it could be signed better and better direction / advice given in this regard but other than that a great facility although expensive at €28 per night even for residents. Hotel itself, is a grand facade of a modern and artistic clean facility in the heart of the city within fifteen minutes walk of the main attractions and / or the tourist red route bus for the less energetic, alternatively €5 in a taxi will get you most places. The staff are polite and attentive speaking several languages, on request we were upgraded to an executive level room which was rather pleasant and spacious. As ever the Spanish don't seem to understand airconditioning and in winter the unit blows hot air which is no use if you are from colder climates, apparently the system can not cope with both and is set to a winter or summer mode but hey there's a window to open and the inner residential courtyard is pleasantly quiet. However for some bizarre reason in such an old solid building the sound travels between rooms, you hear the people above in the toilet and cleaners vacuums on the carpet which can be a pain but isn't a nuisance... a few shortcomings in the executive area or shall I say empty pastries cabinet and tempromental Nespresso coffee maker with two seats... The in room entertainment is very limited for this type of hotel, just local TV channels with some world news options but do try the i/ii button in the evenings for original language dual broadcasts. We had a load of hassle with our room cards in regard to the lift operation... Unless you have a fat wallet don't eat nor drink in the hotel as there are many bars nearby and restaurants, Barcelona itself is a very expensive place but at €6 for a draught small lager frankly "no way hose A" which is in the nearby supermarket for €0.50 or other bars at half the price - eat out, drink out, sleep in. The bar steward tried to "fizz up" flat champgane as he poured it and I mean f-l-a-t which at €10.50 a glass was not acceptable, an immediate complaint however was made and a new bottle opened so problem resolved... but should never have happened. Overall it's a good location which we paid £61 for on Last Minute so no complaints here, I would use it again and recommend it so long as I park nearby and bring a picnic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff and Hotel but poor housekeeping service”
Reviews.Author: Umbastik
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights with my wife and parents. Nice Xmas lightings on the facade of the hotel , upon arrival a nice jazz orchestra was playing in the lobby which was very appreciated and contibuted to our vacation atmosphere. At the check-in we were upgraded (?) to Executive floor (5th) where a nice coffee corber is available with pastries 24hrs. The rooms, nice and large enough, recently refurbished in some way showed some lack of cleaningless. On the second night we opened the minibar and found an open and half full bottle of champagne. it means the minibar was not checked for at least 2 days before our arrival. The kettle for boiling water in room are dirty and unusable. you better check them before put water in it. The shower-head could be cleaner. Courtesy kit is rich and very good quality. Beds are large and very comfortable. Internet conncetion is free if you have a smartphone or a laptop. The one in the lobby is at charge. Garage is clean and we could easily find a lot but the ramp is though to go out with a station wagon.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: pauli2hands
Reviews.Content: My wife & I spent 3 nights here and it fulfilled our every need. The location is a mere 3 blocks (10-15mins walk) from Placa de la Catalunya at the top of Las Ramblas). We strolled from here, past the square, via Casa Bootlia, La Pedrera, on to Sagrada Famila in no time at all. An ideal location where we never felt at risk at night. Locaiton, location, location. The double room itself was immaculate. On the 2nd floor right above the main entrance to the hotel gave a nice city view although this was compromised by the fact that it was on a main street (Grand Via de las Catalunyas). If you want location in Barca, you're gonna have to live with some street noise! Well appointed, well lit & modern with a crisp large bathroom which included a bath & shower. Housekeeping was great. After our first night we lay in & housekeeping arrived 3 times attempting to clean the room.... even as late as 17:00 hours! Excellent. The only faults with housekeeping were: we ran out of tissues (not toilet paper, tissues) and these were not replenished. Given other reviews, I did listen out for the Metro trains running beneath the hotel. If you listen for it you will hear it... possibly even feel it: but it in no way impinged on our well deserved good nights' sleep. There are tea & coffee making facilities but for some reason the only coffee provided was decoffee(ie)nated. Mini bar was well stocked & well priced given where we were. Reception/Concierge staff were happy, smiling & keen to help though a little short on detail ("Is it safe here at Night?".... "That depends."... "On what?"... on whether you are walking or in a taxi.".... "OK, walking here late at night."... "Well, that depends."... "On what?"... "On where you are walking from."... and so the story went on. Security is well managed with staff at the front door and the need to use your room card to operate the lift. Having said that, we did have friends in the wee hours come up to our room for a late drink with no questions asked. When one of us walked in to the hotel at about 11pm explaining that the other had the room keys we were shown directly to the stairs with no inquiry.... I guess they just recognised my face! On Fri/Sat evenings they advertise a "Cocktails & Swing" evening. Worth a quick drink but no more than that. As ever, careful in Barca. This hotel is clean, well presented & in a prime location just a couple of blocks off the beaten path. Location, location, location are the selling points & it ticks all the boxes in terms of value, cleanliness & facilities (we did NOT use the rooftop pool in November though the sauna might have been a good idea!).

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Uktraveller_SB
