Reviews.Content: I spent along time researching hotels in Barcelona. Eventually i went with the Havana. Regarding location its very near most sites but if i am honest its one or two block to far away but perfectly manageable and near underground. The hotel is perfectly pleasant but i felt there was something missing on the atmosphere front. The colours were a little dull and bland, and there was no real wow factor. The first room we had was v small and looked onto a wall which i know a few reviews have mentioned, we asked for a new room and staff were very helpful, but if you are staying 3 nights you would expect not to have to ask for aview. The room we eventually had was nice enough but not a great deal of natural light. However the hotel upgraded us and staff were very helpful and room was very clean and very comfortable. So all in all you cannot go wrong with this hotel, it just needs some "wow factor" adding, if everything was like the web site it would be really great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Lironp
Reviews.Content: Great location- walking distance to just about everywhere, and a close metro station. When we checked in we received a really tiny room (just a small margin of space around the bed), but after complaining we received a larger room, that also had space for an armchair. The room and bathroom were very clean and had a very nice decoration. One thing about the staff- they seemed nice, but couldn't help us with most of our questions or tips, as they hardly spoke English- not what I would expect from the people at the front desk... In general, the hotel was great value for money, and definitely worth its 4 star rating

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel-good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Birminghamgirl068
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 night stay at this hotel. Really enjoyed our stay-excellent location, located close to centre.Convenience store located nearby. Useful fridge,safety deposit box, kettle+toiletries in room. Rooms were modern and cleaned thoroughly each day.Service was excellent and staff friendly.Breakfast was excellent with lots of choice. We were able to walk to Sagrada Familia and the beach at Port Olympic from the hotel. An enjoyable stay-would definitely come again. Disadv of hotel:swimming pool was a little small and water very cold but otherwise rooftop area lovely

Reviews.Title: “Great location & service”
Reviews.Author: jeh106
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night prior to a cruise. We were victims of a bird poop scam and lost our credit cards & passports. The staff at the hotel did everything they could to help including calling the credit card companies, our cruise line and setting us up with the U.S. Consulate. Kudos to the front desk staff. In addition, they were helpful in telling us about places outside the hotel to eat. Our room was very modern with high definition, flat panel television, en suite bathroom with nice amenities, comfortable beds and pillows. No view but who cares since we were there only one night. Breakfast buffet was immense and delicious. I highly recommend this hotel for its convenience to local sights & shopping and the cruise terminals.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a city of expensive hotels!”
Reviews.Author: TDMB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early Sept 2009 with my boyfriend. We got a half price deal on Lastminute.com and paid just £56 per room per night so I guess, on that basis, I thought it was excellent for the money - but given the average cost of a half decent in central Barcelona these days, even at full price it would still have been reasonable. Foyer area is OK, a little dated as some people have said. The glass atrium is impressive, but didn't really have quite the Wow factor I was hoping for based on the website. Our room was a double, and I'd read on here that all the doubles faced a brick wall so was expecting the worst. However we had a reasonable view over a central garden/courtyard type area which, although quite functional looking, at least meant that plenty of light came into the room. The room itself was very small, but perfectly adequate and very nicely decorated. Modern, clean and comfortable, which is all you really need from a mid priced city centre hotel. There was also a good audio system and a 26" LCD TV. We were on the 3rd floor but did not experience any road or Metro noise. Bathroom was a good size, shower was good, very powerful, excellent range of toiletries supplied. Hairdryer was one of those dodgy ones that hang on the wall with a hose affair attached, like a Hoover, so take your own if you prefer a decent one! The best bit for me was the kettle. So few Mediterranean hotels have these. But bring your own tea bags as you don't get many and they looked a bit dubious! Also, had to ask for extra sugar and milk at the bar on the 2nd day as this was not replenished , yet the toiletries were! It was no bother though and the barman gave us a jug of fresh milk which we then kept in the fridge (another useful facility!) The wifi did require a username and password every 24 hours but again this was no big deal, reception was never that busy, and when we phoned one morning to ask for the details, they said they were too complicated to read out over the phone, but offered to bring them to the room instead. And sure enough a porter arrived with a printout 10 minutes later! Which was pretty good service I thought. The rooftop pool area and terrace are very nice. Not quite up to Hotel 1898 standard but not bad at all. (The Hotel 1898 is on the Ramblas and is amazing, but you need a second mortgage to stay there, so for special occasions only unless you manage to get a bargain. Non residents can use the rooftop bar though and I highly recommend a visit) . Pool is small and only about a metre deep but fine for cooling off after a lie in the sun. There are only about 10 sunbeds so, whilst we didn't have a problem getting one ourselves, I can see how it might be an issue at busy times. The deck area round the pool is good though so you could lie there, or bring a chair up from the terrace where there are many tables, chairs and brollies. On the downside, the ice cream/food/drink kiosk didn't open while we were there which was a bit of a shame if we'd wanted lunch or something, and the drink vending machine gave me Coke even though I pressed the Fanta button! All in all a nice area though, and pool towels are supplied in the room which is great. There is also a good shower room by the pool with toiletries which you can use on your last day after you've checked out. Very handy. Location-wise, this hotel was a little further from the Ramblas than I was expecting, but even so, still only a 15 min walk to the top, by the Place de Catalunya. However, the Metro is brilliant and I highly recommend you use that. Clean, fast and efficient. And ridiculously cheap. We got a T10 ticket which gives you 10 journeys over as many days as you like (I think they are valid for a month) for just 7.70 Euros. Plus, you can also use the T10 to get to or from the airport on the RENFE which goes every half hour on the grey line. This was also really easy and whilst we didn't use it when we arrived, we did use it to get back to the airport with our remaining 'journey', so in effect the trip was free, as opposed to costing around 30 Euros in a taxi! One thing to note though, if you get on at the Passeig de Gracia (the nearest RENFE station to the hotel), it's a bit of a long walk to the platform once you're under ground so allow an extra 15 mins more than you'd expect. All in all I thought this hotel was a good choice and would recommend, and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, stylish rooms and good location”
Reviews.Author: Saga_F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silken Gran Havana 3 nights during our tour in Italy and Spain. The reason why we chose this hotel was because it was centrally located, had stylish looking rooms and a pool. We also got an excellent deal from lastminute.com (£53 per night per room without breakfast). For that price we were more than happy. + Location is good. A short stroll from plaza catalonia. + Rooms were stylish and had everything a 4 star hotel should have (special mention for toiletries and soundsystem) + Beautiful building and fresh looking public areas + Free internet - Breakfast was extremely pricey (5 star prices) - Pool area is very small and crowded during August (we understand that very little can be done to that since it’s very warm during August and most of the guests want to use the pool area) There is so much to see in Barcelona that we didn’t spend too much time in our room. However, for our purpose, this hotel was very satisfying.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DAYTRIPPER63_9
Reviews.Content: really nice Hotel, staff very helpful, once you get your bearings very easy to get to all the major tourist points, as short walk to a number of metro stations Placa De Catalunya is only about 5 minutes walk away, if you are arriving by bus from the airport the bus stops right outside the El Corte Ingles department store and its a short walk from here with hand luggage, look to pay about between 5 and 7 euro's in a Taxi....the rooftop pool is not deep about 3ft but good for cooling in the sun, there are about 10 sunloungers so can seem a bit crowded but there are also tables and chairs and a cafe to get snaks and drinks, so in all a really nice area to relax after a morning touring the city and charging your batteries for the evening...... getting around the city is great we got a day ticket called the T-Dia from the metro station and this gives a whole day on metro/buses/trams/trains for 5.65 euros you can get them for more than one day if needed excellent value as zone 1 covers most of the city if not all and the sightseeing tour bus was 21 euros much better value to get the day ticket as it gives you access to all the transport links and so easy to use which means you are not having to search around for change or notes at every station or bus stop..if going to the beach from the hotel the easy way is walk up to Giron metro station about 5 minutes away and get the yellow line to Barceloneta or Ciutadella and follow the crowds, there is a supermacado supermarket close to Girona metro station so a good idea to buy you snacks and water here as much cheaper than by the beach area if going the nou camp you need the blue line and get off at Collblanc this line will also take you to Sagra Familia if traveling from Girona metro get off at Verdaguer (one stop) AND CHANGE TO BLUE LINE.... Las Ramblas is really nice to stroll down early morning not too early 9am ish as gettis really busy later in the day, don't be put off buy all the pickpocket stories, every large city has this just keep your wits about you not every one is trying to steal from you and there are some really talented street artists in this area

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: rea5
Reviews.Content: excellent choice for our 4 day break in barcelona, with my husband and 8 and 14 yr. Family room consisted of two rooms both large and very nicely presentedwith hi-fi, flat screen tvs in bothrooms. The roof toppool was a great hit with the children and my self for a spot of sunbathing. staff very helpful and spoke good english. We took the airbus from outside the airport 7 euros return get of at he playa cataluna walk 2 blocks to the left then turn right and walk 3 blocks (u can see the roof terrace umberals) very handy and no more than 10 min walk cant wait to go back,

Reviews.Title: “A Little Noisy but Otherwise OK”
Reviews.Author: baozao
Reviews.Content: On arrival (about 13.30) my room was not ready which is unusual and slightly annoying so had to go off and get something to eat and mooch about for an hour. The reception area looks pretty tired compared to how nice my room was...very clean and modern with a high ceiling, flat screen TV, coffee making facilities, in-room safe and a good selection of toiletries. The only real gripe I have is that it was pretty noisy what with the traffic from the Gran Via outside, the rumbling of the metro trains below and the rather thin walls between rooms. The first two factors can probably be avoided if you ask for a room away from the main street and a higher floor (I was on the 2nd). The staff were a mixed bunch...some extremely friendly and helpful and others that were just reaching average in their customer service skills. I only ate a snack at the pool which was small and slightly over priced...a 200ml bottle of Coke is 2.95 Euros...a total rip off! As the hotel food was quite expensive I decided to buy some pastries for breakfast else where which I washed down with the free in-room coffee (note: no English breakfast tea provided so take your own if necessary!). The hotel is located a very easy 15 min walk from the centre and it's in a pleasant district so no need to worry about going on foot. My favourite point is the roof swimming pool area...such a pleasant and convenient way to cool down, escape the bustle and watch the sun go down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jake_Worf
Reviews.Content: Just perfect for a 4 day visit in Barcelona. room was great - clean - calm. breakfast just perfect. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and good location”
Reviews.Author: baddoffen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to la Rambla, and for us it was a perfect place to stay when exploring Barcelona. The staff was helpful and provided very good service, which was valuable for first time visitors like us. The room was nice, with contemporary design features and clean. When we visited Barcelona in early march, it was unusually hot for the season (25'-28' Celsius) and the AC wasn't set for cooling yet. This was no big problem for us, since we had a room facing the quiet backyard and no noise when sleeping with window open. When we return to Barcelona we'll seriously consider staying at the Gran Havana again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly, helpful staff. Great Location, Roof top pool invaluable”
Reviews.Author: LancashirePayne
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day trip to Barcelona with my teenage daughter. Hotel was excellent in terms of helpfulness and friendliness of staff and location.The foyer is a bit dated and lacks a bit of charm but that is the only negative. The bedrooms are modern and spacious. The roof top bar is lovely to watch the sun go down. The hotel has'cocktails and swing' nights on fri/sat's in the summer, which is a nice touch. I had read previous reviews, therefore requested a 'quiet' room (not facing the Gran Via road.) We were given a room on the side road which was excellent for traffic noise. It was modern, airconditioned and even had a small balcony! The kettle in our room was appreciated as it saved us a fortune in that we didnt need to take breakfast in the hotel at(18.50 Euros)per person! but could have it in our room instead. Location of Hotel great for restaurants (Tapas 24 and Thai Gardens ), both 5 mins walk away and the main square Catalunya with Hard Rock Cafe, The Ramlas, the Bus Tours just 10 minutes walk away. Hotel only 5 mins walk to the Metro where we got the train to the beach (Port Olympica) 10 mins by train. Roof top pool a treat at the end of a sight seeing day, even had a spotless shower and mirror to change for our return flight! Excellent, I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: PDXvoyager
Reviews.Content: What an excellent surprise. Very centrally located. You can walk to Gracias and the Block of Discord or to the Ramblas within about 5 minutes. Boqaria market is about 10 minutes by foot. Between two Metro stations. Rooms are modern, clean, and large. The staff was very helpful. The rooftop pool and spa are also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Nice Area of town”
Reviews.Author: AnnaParrott
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and spacious. We stayed in room 101 and it was very spacious, large bathroom and plenty of room for two people.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location, Good Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: PeterBean
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in October 2008. The hotel is very modern and clean. We received an upgrade to the top floor rooms on arrival. i cannot comment on the other rooms for that reson. Our rooms were excellent. Spacious with lovely balconies overlooking the main street. This may not sound appealing but it was nice to take in the sights and sounds of the city for a height. The beds, as many have said, were certainly firm but we all slept very well every night. The hotel is very quiet on a night. There was a rooftop pool which looked good although we didn't have time to use it. There is a piano bar on the ground floor which is great before going out on an evening. The atmosphere accompanied with live music make the hotel a nice place to be. it should be noted however that the bar prices are high. Especially for cocktails. We had vouchers for half price but they still weren't cheap. The breakfast was disappointing in my opinion and we only used the facility once (at an extra cost). Much better to go out and eat at a local cafe we found. The location is fairly good. Approximately 10 minutes from the shopping area and around 15 minutes from Las Ramblas. The area seemed safe to walk on an evening and there was usually people around. As with any trip to Barcelona, pick pockets to have a presence so watch your belongings. During our long weekend stay, we didn't have any trouble I may add. Overall, a nice, quiet hotel. Ideal for a couple of family with older children.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. spoilt by poor room service”
Reviews.Author: Duggi
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, centrally located with well furnished, comfortable rooms. Room service was a disaster, slow and inefficient. Soiled bedding not changed, complimentary wine delivered without opener or glasses. Only 1 tea bag and 1 coffee sachet per day !!! All problems had to driven by the guest. No management on-site to address issues. Also a cautioary note about booking double rooms, apparently all face a brick walll!!! Lost a shirt, tried to follow up along with complaints about room service via email and letter, absolutely no response. A nice hotel ruined by poor servce and attitude towards guests.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in centra location”
Reviews.Author: TTK
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel. We had rooms on the first floor and they were off a reasonable size and very tastefully decorated. This is the first hotel in Barcelona that I have stayed in that provides a kettle in the room - they don't however give you much tea/coffee or milk but you could of course always bring / get your own. In the bathroom you will find shampoo, shower gel, after shave, moisteriser, sewing kit, comb etc and these were replaced every day unlike some other hotels I have stayed in. My only complaint about the room was that it was a bit stuffy and the window would only open fully rather than a little bit. Also as we were on the first floor, facing the street it did get a little noisy so I would suggest asking for a room on a higher floor if you think noise might bother you. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful and there is a nice bar area on the ground floor. The hotel has rooftop sundeck and pool, which was great after a day of sightseeing / shopping. They also provide in your rooms towels to use. There is also a sauna and you just have to advise reception when you want to use it. In terms of location the hotel is very central and we managed to walk everywhere. It is only about 5 / 10 minute walk to the Passeig de Gracia / Placa Catalunya / Ramblas and about 5 minute walk to the nearest metro. We got the bus from the airport and it took us 10 minutes max from Placa Catalunya. Being so central there are several good bars and restaurants nearby. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very central”
Reviews.Author: chucksy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in March. Hotel is clean, central, and staff pleasant. Easy walk to Las Ramblas, do not use taxis unless absolutely necessary, they charged us 15 euros for a 1 mile ride. HOWEVER back to the hotel - I reported a pair of ladies trousers missing from the bathroom. I guessed what had happened as they were white trousers that the maid has obviously picked them up with the towels and dropped them in with the laundry. When I reported it, the girl on reception was very helpful and said they would follow it up. However 3 e-mails and 2 phone calls later and no-one wants to know. I did not even get an apology. Word of warning - don't leave expensive items of clothing lying around at this hotel, especially if they are white.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Choice”
Reviews.Author: walnut123
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Barcelona. Stayed 4 nights at this property. The hotel faces a busy street. My initial impressions of Bacelona was cars and motocycles followed by more motorcycles and cars. Although the windows were double paned insulated, the room facing Via Corts were noisy. We were on the second Floor. The rooms were large by European standards, modern with little personality. We were allowed to check in at 8am. The staff all spoke English and were very nice. Our room did not include breakfast which was the first time for us at a hotel in Europe. Not a problem to find an inexpensive breakfast but not as convenient. The rooftop was pleasant with a sauna, small pool and lots of chairs. The location was okay but could have been better. The TV had CNBC and CNN. Beds were very confortable. I would certainly consider this propert again if staying in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “So So Stay”
Reviews.Author: highdesertbadger
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gran Silken Havana for three nights on my current tour of Spain and Portugal. I booked the hotel directly and received a fairly good rate by Barcelona standards. The hotel is not too far from the Plaza Catalunya and the Passeig de Gracia. It is a fairly nice property, but !! Do not get a room on one of the lower floors. I was on the 1st. floor facing the Gran Via. The traffic noise was terrible. I could also hear the subway running beneath the hotel. I did not get a decent nights sleep during my entire stay. The property seemed clean and the staff were friendly. I did not use the restaurant during my stay. Internet access was an extra charge, not that much but with a so so connection. The neighborhood seemed to be safe and there were a number of places to eat and drink close by. This would not be my first choice should I return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Chamed1
Reviews.Content: Never having been to Barcelona and celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary we wanted our four day stay to be perfect. Searched on-line with various hotels and found the Gran Havana, instantly beautiful from the outside and on the inside. Arrived via taxi from the bus station to what I can only describe as 'picture perfect' - everything we could have wished for and more - absolutely beautiful. At reception, they were exceptionally pleasant and spoke very good English. Checked in very quickly and then taken to our room, again faultless and immaculate. The Gran Havana couldn't be more central. We were close enough to the centre of all amenities, but far enough away for it not to be noisy. We used a two day pass with Bus Touristic which was exceptionally beneficial as we could not have seen all the things we wanted to have had we not have done this. You can use the buses as a hop on hop off service and see all the tourist attractions ar your leisure. Buses come along every 7-15 minutes, which was fantastic. We saw everything we wanted to see and more. Highly recommend this! We did a lot of walking as well but walking alone you could not see all the sites. We ate at a wee Itialian called Gino's, which was gorgeous and very reasonably priced considering the price of the Euro at the moment. We also ate at a place called 'Brown' which was quite posh, but again, faultless food. Our last night we went to the Hard Rock Cafe, and if you love music, cocktails and excellent food then this is the place to go. Read up (a lot!!!) on Barcelona prior to going and had concerns about the pickpocketers and back snatching but never had any problems with this at all or felt threatened om the slightest. As long as you are cautious and look after your belongings, you'll be absolutely fine. Would go back again in a heartbeat and stay at the Gran Havana - perfect wedding anniversary! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Central”
Reviews.Author: BAIC03
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our-post stay from our Med Cruise. We took a taxi from the port and arrived at 0900, expecting to drop off our luggage and come back later. Imagine our surprise when they said our room was ready! My husband spoke to them in Spanish ( I know Italian and French) and they were very accomodating, switching to English when he got stuck on the spanish word for umbrella (sombrilla). It was raining quite a bit. They even had the hotel decorated for Christmas; trees and lights everywhere. Our room was large. Had a HUGE, HUGE, HUGE bathroom with a big tub, toilet and bidet. Our queen size bed was very comfy, we had a flat screen TV, a wall mounted radio, and a hot pot and tea bags to make our our tea. Breakfast was included but we left too early to use it. There is a txi stand right outside- they will take you anywhere. It's a 10 min walk to Sagrada Familia, a 5 min walk to the top of Las Ramblas and the Hard Rock Cafe. Love this hotel. Will stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal w/discounted rate”
Reviews.Author: koba-sf
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Gran Hotel Havana, made a discounted reservation thru United.com hotel reservation (actually it's Expedia) at US$215/night. I took Airport bus to Plaça de Catalunya then 10+ minutes walk to the hotel, very convenient. At the reception they speak good English and did a very smooth check-in process for me. They put me on the 6th floor. It's a standard double room but roomy enough for me. Unlikely from another European hotels, the room was very spacious. Room equipments are nice and new - wall mounted TV and CD player, fancy halogen desk light, easy-to-use safe, etc. The double bed is actually "two singles" but comfortable enough for me as a side sleeper. Bathroom amenities are reasonably good quality but no hair conditioners so I went to the closest farmácia, where is in a same block, to buy one. Location is very nice: only 3 blocks away from Passeig de Gràcia metro station, even Girona L4 station is closer. Because the hotel is located on Gran Vía main street, I didn't have to worry about the safety because of lots of traffics and walkers are out there even in midnights. Rooftop pool and sauna looked very fancy and nice although I couldn't use it in November... must return in summer season. Also, live jazz at the lounge in weekend evenings are another fancy opportunity. Bottom line: this hotel does have worth spending US$215/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Gran Hotel Havana”
Reviews.Author: Steve2006Dublin
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 days at the Gran Hotel Havana with my wife (#1) and two sons (10 & 16). We had adjoining rooms on the 3rd Floor. Good rooms with air con, TV on wall, room safe, spotless bathroom, cleaned every day etc. We availed of the internet offer which included breakfast at a reduced rate. Breakfast is excellent and well worth the price especially when with kids - choice of breads, croissants, cereals, eggs, bacon, sausage, great fresh fruits, cold meats, cheeses and desserts! The rooftop pool was used by our sons. Everything about this hotel is great. Staff were also very helpful and patient with our broken Spanish. The Irish and the Catalans get on well anyway.. 'OO's of years under oppression from a foreign power may be one reason! The location is the great bonus. 15 minutes from Placa De Catalunya and Passeig De Graca. We could walk everywhere, even as far as Port Vell. When tired, the Metro was a couple of blocks away. One tip: avoid La Rambla. Our first afternoon, I caught a pickpocket with her hand in my pocket. She just laughed and walked on. there was no police presence. Her and her partner were posing as tourists with map, guudebook etc. I was on alert though. We spent the afternoon spotting pickpockets at work, including my own protagonist. Why do the police tolerate this? Even with this, Barcelona is a fantastic city and ranks with the best. Shopping, especially in the narrow streets east of La Rambla is probably among the best - right up there with Berlin and more affordable than Paris. Recommended restaurants:Sept Portes, Quinze Nits, Quatro Gatos, Taxidermista. We will be back and will certainly stay at this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: parker_luke
Reviews.Content: Invited to Barcelona by a supplier for an exhibition. Needless to say we had a great time and the hotel made it even more enjoyable. Grand entrance leading to open plan check in/bar & lounge area. Staff very polite all speaking good English aswell. Decor is clean, fresh and new. With a great spirraling view right through the centre of the hotel to the glass skylight on the roof from the bar. The room was great. Sitting area, desk, plasma tv on the wall, mini-bar etc etc. Everything you could need. The bathroom was slightly on the small side but had everthing you needed and to a high standard and not enough to change my 5 Star Rating. The views from the roof top with pool are well worth a look and again very clean and tidy up there. Patio heaters, tables and chairs also available. Breakfast had plenty of choice and all the food was fresh, especially the fruits which were already sliced for you. All in all fantastic and only 10 minutes walk from Las Ramblas... I cannot wait until my next visit when Ill take the Girlfriend.

Reviews.Title: “still having back pains”
Reviews.Author: sister2ny
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel for three nights after a cruise. Although it was not a bad hotel and had some good points such as being in walking distance from shopping areas, restarants and la ramba we found the beds to be almost unbearable they were as hard as bricks. Most nights my sister could not lay on the bed for more than a couple of hours at a time she chose to sit in one of the chairs because they were more comfortable. Another thing was eventhought, they had a wonderful large screen televison there were no english channels. So my sugestion would be if you do not enjoy sleeping on a hard bed do not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SusanR421
Reviews.Content: We were going on a cruise which left from Barcelona. We arrived the day before our cruise left. Having never been to Europe, I didn't know what to expect. The hotel was about 1/2 from the airport. We arrived almost 3 hours later than expected since our flight from NY was late in leaving. Most people had already checked in so there were no rooms at the level we booked available. They upgraded us to a 2 room suite. It was fantastic. We were a little concerned since it was in the front of the hotel, but we never even heard the noise from the traffic outside. The rooms were clean, bright and the bed was really comfortable. The staff at the front desk were friendly. They recommended a restaurant and even made the reservations for us. At times there was a problem with language, but it didn't really bother us. In the morning we had breakfast in the hotel. It's a buffet and pretty good. They charge it to your room. All in all it was a great stay and we would definitely book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Smachel
Reviews.Content: A little concerned after reading some of the reviews but couldn't find a single fault with this Hotel. The two rooms we booked were next to each other as requested. We were upgraded to the executive floor (I have no idea why) but we certainly weren't complaining. Fresh complimentary pastries every morning & proper coffee. Our room was on the 5th floor overlooking the main road but we didn't experience much road noise at all, & even if we had we could hardly complain, what do you expect from a city centre hotel? Huge huge bed, flat sreen tv & up to date sound system. All staff friendly & professional. Enjoyed late night drinks on the roof, by the pool overlooking the city. Didn't eat in the hotel as breakfast seemed quite expensive but there are plenty of places nearby to tempt your tastebuds, only a short walk to las ramblas & placa catalunya. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for a stay in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: FriendlyMunster
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week in this hotel-was a little weary prior to arrival because of the mixed reviews!!!it is perfect... nice building, excellent cleaning of room,lovely roof top to chill by pool nd bar!!breakfast is pricey but you don't have to eat there!!!brilliant loctaion-near main square with loads of transport options and walking distanct to la rambla!!!so central we only used metro a few times.... Go stay ere.

Reviews.Title: “The service was resentful & rude”
Reviews.Author: jetproof
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice but the fact that the hotel was ordered and pre-paid for through Expedia seemed to bother the manager. He at first demanded we let him hold our passports and hold a credit card in his safe. We refused and he then allowed us to pre-pay for incidentals with a credit card. We seemed to receive "resentful" check in service. This attitude also seemed to impact our over all service. The hotel also tried to over charge us on items such as "mini bar" that we never used. They also tried to over charge us on airport transportation, they tried to charge us $60 euros for a $35 euro trip. They tried over charging on various other items.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chappers-Chappess
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with a couple of friends. It is in a good location for all the sites of Barcelona, just a short walk from la ramblas. The hotel looks grand from the outside, and is fairly grand in the lobby area too. There was a small bar in the lobby for a quick drink before and after your sight seeing! Our room was a good size, tea and coffee making facilites and a nice bathroom. Linen and towels were clean and a view over the roof tops to the cathedral. Breakfast was good (although expensive), lots of different foods on offer plus juice and coffee/tea etc. The concierge was helpful, got us Barcelona tickets for the game on the sunday night - excellent seats! An excellent break in Barca!

Reviews.Title: “A great city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: citybreaker32
Reviews.Content: First of all I would like to say that my stay in this hotel was a great experience. I booked my stay in Barcelona at the very last minute and took this hotel without doing any research. After I booked it I read some very negative reports from fellow travellers on this site and was fully expecting to change my hotel after one night. I could not have been more wrong. Booking in was easy and efficient. Good reception staff and really helpful. I got an automatic upgrade to a much bigger room with a lovely bathroom. It was noisy outside (as you would expect from a city centre) but the windows were effective at cutting this out. The location was first class, right in the city centre and brilliant for all the tourist and shopping bits. Only 10 mins walk from Placa de Catalunya, the same from La Pedrera and El Corte Ingles. The bed was comfortable and there was a nice big TV to watch. The room was cleaned beatifully every day and there were loads of good toiletries etc to use. Very unusually, there was loads of lighting in the room making reading really easy. Breakfast was a triumph. At only €17 a day I managed to have a huge meal (breakfast like a king, they say) setting me up for a day's sightseeing without the need for a big lunch. Hot and cold food alike, it was all good quality and plentiful. I fail to understand why anyone should think so poorly of this lovely and good value hotel. I shall make a point of returning to the Gran Havana when I next go to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, contempary hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarbersManchester_
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 day stay in Barca, Hotel is clean, contempary interior, nice rooms, Lovely roof top pool with loungers. Good location for las Ramblas, and other attractions. only sore point, staff at reception a bit cold, never smile !! Otherwise would stay at hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy but not ecstatic at the Havana”
Reviews.Author: Degas
Reviews.Content: Business trip meant a couple of nights in Barcelona at the end of June and was placed in this hotel. It was fine - good central situation - about a 10 min walk to the Ramblas - but not too noisy. My room on the fifth floor was compact and had a stunning view (of a cream painted wall about 10 feet away!). Every thing worked from the AC, wireless internet to a good shower- and although I did not see it I understand there is a roof top pool. Usual buffet selection at breakfast - included hot choices and fresh orange juice. We had booked a meeting room which being on the ground floor at the front of the hotel had a small problem with passers by staring in - but easily solved by closing the blind. Wouldn't say it was the most stunning hotel - but being clean, functional and well situated is pretty much all I want on a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Spoilt buy noisy late night music”
Reviews.Author: sham63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights at the beginning of March. Unfortunately, we expereinced problems with very loud late night music from the function room below our room - see below. The hotel was easy to find - it's a 10 minute walk from where the Aerobus drops of at Placa De Catalunya. We arrived at about 9pm but couldn't check in as the computer system was 'down' and there was no manual backup to tell staff which rooms were available or occupied. We were told to come back later! Went for a meal, came back 2 hours later and our room was ready. Nice room - as you would expect for this class of hotel. We were on the back of the hotel on the first floor - these rooms have a small sitting out area which is nice (there are only about 6 rooms with this facility) Room was quiet as requested. On Friday night there was a private party in the function room on the ground floor directly beneath our room. It had started when we got back to our room at around 10pm, but there was no music so it was barely audible in our room. However, at 11:30pm the disco started, and it was really loud in our room. I phoned reception who assured me that it would stop at 12:30am. It didn't stop - it got louder. Phoned again at 12:45am and told it would stop at 1:00am. By 1:15am it was still going so we demanded to be moved. They gave us a room on the 5th floor which was quiet, but it was no fun moving at that time of the morning. As you can imagine this ruined our night's sleep. In conclusion I would be vary wary of staying in this hotel over a weekend in case this is a regular occurance. The management obviously care more about letting the fuction room out for discos than the comfort of hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: markznyc
Reviews.Content: You really cannot get a better deal in Barcelona. The location is perfect. In the middle of multiple sightseeing districts without being trapped on the tourist track. Excellent, English speaking staff. Modern clean rooms. I am truly suprised at how there could be any negative reviews -- the place is really solid. If you like boutique hotels (W, and such) but are sick of the attitude, this is a nice alternative. A beautiful roof deck with great views of the city (plus a bottle of cheap Cava from the minibar) really tops the place off. It was a bit cool for swimming, but in the summer, this place must be killer. All in all a great stay (3 days) in a great city. Food tip: try El Portalon for excellent, down and dirty (and cheap) tapas and Noti for a hip night out. Disappointing was Bottifumerio, whose seafood was solid, if not unique, but whose bright lighting and 1950's interior made dinner feels like Sunday at the Jersey shore's most expensive seafood shack.

Reviews.Title: “A really good choice in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: The-Wandering-Whites
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel with Ford Motor Co in 1992, when planning a week's trip to Barcelona in August 2005 we decided to re-visit the hotel as a family and were so pleased that we did. The hotel were more than helpful when we booked their 'package' on line and, despite other reviews content, the reception speak very good english!and made sure all our requests were dealt with. We were travelling with my 10 year old son and the hotel upgraded us to a 6th floor balcony room which was quieter and was so nice to sit out on after a long day sightseeing. The rooms are not huge but could not be called small in any way and are very comfortable and well furnished-especially the marble bathrooms.Although we didn't book the family package with museum visits etc., the hotel very kindly left one of the Gran Havana teddy bears which were part of the pack in the room for my son-a very nice touch. The location is absolutely ideal for all the major tourist attractions and an easy 20 minute journey from the airport. In the 10 years plus since first visiting this hotel the standards, service and furnishings were every bit as good second time round and I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. This is an excellent choice when visiting Barcelona-go there!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: PB&SK
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with classy rooms. Good location - 15 min walk from main bus station where Girona airport buses arrive. Less than 10 mins to start of Ramblas and main stores
